conbody.note: The content of this chapter is only relevant for SPS-VNF. The CNF equivalent for CDR mapping is called DR distribution rules (refer to section Distribution rules in the SPS CNF Overview Guide).
conbody.p: CDR mapping provides flexibility to the operators to configure writing CDR files in a dedicated file structure on CDR consumer nodes based on parameters provided in the CDR. it allows the operator to configure the index used by the CDR module (for writing CDR/EDR in appropriate files/directories) instead of keeping fixed values for each application.
